So how does that justify a ban? Anytime I said to group is when our top lane & Jungler harassed me and this random nami for losing bot & dying to a fed khazix who got fed off mid and our jungler. He was very fed early in so I told everyone we need to group or lose cuz he's just hunting people down at this point. Force teamfights. Then I defended nami getting told she never wards cuz she dies anytime she tries to. And everyone time i said to group or we lose it was toward the snarky top telling me i'm wrong which made no sense. And I never harassed him. Then you see me saying gg report jax or ur banned jax. Everytime I said that it was after a line of him telling me to kill myself, that i'm a %%% or suck dick at the game. I don't see why I was banned? Maybe a chat restriction? But even then I don't see why I would get one just for telling my team to group or saying we lose toward the one harassing me for losing bot. So basically you can say oh fuck I suck, or well that's cancer I got blinded. Just stuff like that. I seriously don't understand how someone looked at this & was like woah! to toxic! ?

Those are my ban/report reasons. Inflammatory for defending myself & trying to make us win? How is me saying the right thing While I'm being insulted inflammatory? I didn't purposely piss someone off and feed fire. I was trying to win because noone would listen and only insulted eachother. 

Offensive??? What did I say that could be taken as offensive? Besides cancer or ass that was used toward no-one and falls under okay in the guidelines?? I'm genuinely confused & upset that I got banned over something like this. All my time & money gone for a report like this??

im sorry to say but Riot considers defending yourself to be toxic behavior... im sorry. you fell for the dumb trap that almost half the other people who get banned for fall for.

No, it's not. **Retaliation** is bannable. If you want to defend yourself, use the mute button. That's the ultimate defense at your disposal.
If you just want to defend your pride and your ego, on the other hand, well... you can even do that. I constantly do it (something I'm trying to fix). But even then, you don't have to retaliate.

"OMFG 0/10, you suck!"
Defense: "Yeah, and 20 assists... I'm a support, you know?"
Retaliation: "So what, you're 0/9 you dumbfuck!"

It's not that complicated. Your life/health is not in danger, your valuables are not in danger, **you** are not in danger (and nobody else is, either). And if you were in such a situation in real life, you could not cite self defense for anything you do. If you break the law trying to "defend" yourself, even though there is no perceived or real danger, it's going to be considered vigilantism and you'll be punished.

If you consider this a "dumb trap", you should probably inform yourself about how the law works or you might get into bigger trouble than getting banned in a video game.

To Riot, defending yourself and retaliation are the same things. If someone says "you suck" and you say "Im trying", that's defending yourself. To say anything in response to someone else's comment that even implies "you're wrong" is considered defending yourself. I can give you the copy/paste reply that Riot gave me saying that defending yourself is a punishable offense if you'd like.

Im not trying to say that you're wrong. Just that your definition of defending yourself is not the same as Riot's definition. Regardless of the form it takes, it's a punishable offense.

Im also not trying to imply that you are dumb for falling for the "Dumb trap" that is self defense. It's just that Riot's stance on defending yourself against comments is so broad that anything that says that the accuser is wrong is considered defending yourself.

1. Retaliation has never been okay. You can defend yourself so long as it's done in a neutral or positive manner. If you're yelling and raging at someone, it's not you defending yourself, it's just you being a jerk. From [Understanding the Tribunal](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2726400): 

>**4) That player in my game was far worse than me. Why am I banned???**
a) I'll keep this one simple: retaliation isn't OK. Reacting to a toxic player by being toxic just incites that player to be even worse--it also ruins the game for up to 8 other players. It is far, far worse to watch two people yelling at each other all game than it is to watch 1 player ranting into blank space. Almost everyone in the game can find someone out there that behaves worse than they do--but so what? Finding someone worse doesn't justify your behavior or justify retaliation. We expect more out of our players. What players often don't realize is... those other players in your game that you thought were worse? Nearly 100% of the time, those players were banned even before you were. If someone is being toxic, just report them and move on. If you retaliate, both of you will be banned. It's really that simple.

2) Riot has ways of tracking peoples smurf accounts you know, so using another account to call people idiots and such is a quick way to get all of your accounts in trouble rather than just the account that you used to throw out insults on.

> It says you can cuss/use strong words as long as it's not toward an actual player or homophobic/racist.

You did use a homophobic slur, though, when repeating what Jax said.

Even then, that is typically not enough alone to result in a permanent ban. However, if you have shown toxic behavior in the past and went up the punishment tiers below a permaban already, then it's more likely that this would result in a harsher punishment. There are 4 tiers of punishment, starting from chat restrictions, and each time you get punished you move up one tier (reforming your behavior can lower your tier over time).

Did you have a 14 day ban before this? If so, that explains how this resulted in a permaban.

Concerning your other behavior, calling to mass report or threatening with reports is considered harassment and is a punishable offense. Please just mute and report players that are causing problems for you; only one report is needed to flag the match to be added to their case for review when triggered, and more reports won't make the system check it any harder.
